item.title: Report E-2025050428
item.description:
Report E-2025050428

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 20, 2025, seven (7) 5-gallon pails of Brickform Refresh were shipped with faulty seal gaskets and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer interior. All impacted absorbents and miscellaneous cleanup debris were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The seven (7) damaged 5-gallon pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2025051545
item.description:
Report X-2025051545

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations supervisor contacted Safety to advise that he was notified of a punctured drum on the dock. The operations supervisor advised roughly 14 gallons leaked onto the dock from the drum before the crew was able to put the drum on its side to stop it from leaking more. The operations supervisor advised he was unsure who punctured the drum, only that it had been sitting on the dock. Safety advised to look into who the forklift operator was who caused the damage and that Safety would contact CURA for remediation. ~~Called CURA and spoke with Juliana who advised a crew would be sent out.

  • City: FRESNO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 16, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon metal pail of paint related material was punctured by a skid and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the product's packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew placed the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. Any spent PPE and clean up debris were containerized in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025050882
item.description:
Report X-2025050882

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-11
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: **POSSIBLE RELEASE**A pallet of plastic jerricans arrived to 155 and it was discovered that one of the containers may have leaked a small amount from the top at some point. The operations manager advised that it appeared that a cap may have been loose on one of the containers causing a small amount to drip down the side of the container and onto the pallet it was on, but advised that the portion that dripped out was dry by the time it was discovered and only dripped onto the pallet it was on and did not get onto the trailer floor or any other surfaces and the cap appears sealed now. The operat ions manager advised there was nothing on scene to clean and just wanted to mention it. Safety advised if they notice any liquid leaking from the container to call back and a crew would be sent out to clean it up.

item.title: Report E-2025050416
item.description:
Report E-2025050416

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-27
  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 18:10 PM ET, Alex Ramirez with ULB contacted the call center to request help with a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Carson, CA. The spill consists of approximately 3 gallons of Brake Cleaner, which released from 155-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture prior to arrival. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist at this is a 6.1 release. The spill is contained to the inside of the trailer. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of UN1992 Brake Cleaner released to the pallet and a trailer floor due to forklift puncture. The crew overpacked the 55-gallon drum into a 95-gallon poly drum, the impacted pallet was containerized in a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1427 ET, XPO-UOA notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 teaspoon of nitric acid released from a metal tote due to the cap being loose. The release impacted just on top of the tote. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined contractors' assistance would be necessary due to it being corrosive and requiring tightly fitting googles but was denied assistance and the SCM Lee Jackson approved of the terminal cleaning the release. Cap will be tightened and continue on to the consignee.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO USA notified ERTS regarding a 110-gal Metal tote IBC of UN1993 kerosene that is actively leaking from the metal elbow weld seam failure. Clean Harbors was notified to assist in transferring it into a new metal tote. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed the 110-gallon metal IBC tote. Clean Harbors personnel gravity feed defected tote into a new tote. The generated waste will remain onsite until the waste profile has been completed and approved for transport for disposal.

  • Description: At 0513 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UKC. It was reported that approximately 4 oz of "Heptane" released from a metal can due to improper loading. The release impacted the inside of trailer #311-2527. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. XPO will place the waste inside of a 20-gallon metal drum. ERTS generated waste ID 233907-1. ERTS notified Chemtrec; Allen provided report #2025041200036.
